intro: Sphalmanthus caudatus, commonly known as the hairy salsify, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and umbel-shaped inflorescences. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, and its roots are often harvested for culinary use. It is also valued for its medicinal properties, with some traditional uses including digestive support and anti-inflammatory effects.
